definition: to distinguish (between different things)/to make distinctions clear
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: How can you distinguish pseudomyopia and true sex myopia?
sentences.chinese: 怎样能分清假性近视和真性近视？

sentences.english: As long as he knows right from wrong, is a good person and is happy.
sentences.chinese: 只要他能分清是非，做个好人并且开开心心就好。

sentences.english: The little girl can tell right from wrong when she is only twelve.
sentences.chinese: 这个小女孩虽然只有十二岁，却能分清是非。

sentences.english: This means knowing the existing constellation of allies, opponents and fence-sitters.
sentences.chinese: 这就意味着要分清敌我以及中立者。

sentences.english: His mind could no longer distinguish between illusion and reality.
sentences.chinese: 他的头脑已不再能分清幻觉和现实。

sentences.english: It is sometimes difficult to disentangle truth from falsehood.
sentences.chinese: 分清真理和谬误有时很难。

sentences.english: We should control how to distinguish the right and wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该学会分清是非。

sentences.english: Blame yourself too young, is the dog did not distinguish.
sentences.chinese: 只怪自己太年轻，是人是狗没分清。

sentences.english: His duty is to check figures, sort marks and inspect any possible damage to cargo.
sentences.chinese: 他的职责是点清数字，分清啧克，检查可能的残损。

sentences.english: Distinguish primary and secondary, it is more important to energy energy puts on the main operation of the website.
sentences.chinese: 分清主次，把精力放在网站的主要运营上更重要。

sentences.english: The great importance of popularizing the common spoken Chinese in Zaozhuang-Tengzhou area is to distinguish between level-lingual and cacuminal.
sentences.chinese: 在枣滕地区推广普通话，最重要的是分清平翘舌声母。

sentences.english: Knowing which is which can make a big difference to the best treatment.
sentences.chinese: 分清孰是孰非对于找到最好的治疗方法非常重要。

sentences.english: We can distinguish between paved runway and unpaved areas.
sentences.chinese: 我们能分清铺砌的跑道和未铺砌的地方。

sentences.english: Can you tell the difference between the twin sister?
sentences.chinese: 你能分清那对孪生姐妹吗？

sentences.english: In a list, prioritize the content
sentences.chinese: 列出优先考虑的内容，分清主次。

sentences.english: A great life is the result of creating priorities.
sentences.chinese: 非凡的人生源于分清主次。

to differentiate/to distinguish/to discriminate

to differentiate/to discriminate
to obscure/to confuse/to mix up/to blur/to mislead
clear/distinct/to understand thoroughly/to be clear about
to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
identification/to identify/to recognize
unclear
